nodes.bodyText:
i believe we can also remove left outer join with t_transaction_results?
We don't handle unknown result type in importer.
Not same can be said for t_transaction_types though, so still need left outer join there.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -39,7 +39,7 @@ const boilerplateSufffix = ` join t_transactions t on tlist.consensus_timestamp
     join t_entities enode on enode.id = t.fk_node_acc_id

nodes.bodyText: Or maybe we can't. I'll leave it as is. Not worth the time to figure since performance impact would be none. (both txn results and txn types table are so small that they'll be in-memory)

     join t_entities enode on enode.id = t.fk_node_acc_id

nodes.bodyText: Did you see an improvement in performance for queries?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -39,7 +39,7 @@ const boilerplateSufffix = ` join t_transactions t on tlist.consensus_timestamp
     join t_entities enode on enode.id = t.fk_node_acc_id

nodes.bodyText: During regular developments, one doesn't do a/b perf test for 'left outer join' vs 'join', so no need here either. Neither I am curious since i don't expect to see any gains :). Just closing the ticket. Conventional wisdom is to not use left outer join since it forces query optimizer to join in certain way.
